fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm

Class AbstractCVM

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm.AbstractCVM
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentVirtualMachineI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDistributedCVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM, CVM

    public abstract class AbstractCVM
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComponentVirtualMachineI
    The class AbstractCVM defines the common properties of component virtual machines in the component model.

    Description

    Local CVM are deployed on a single Java virtual machine and have local component interconnections only. A CVM must define a deploy method that includes all the code necessary to instantiate and interconnect the static components in the application. Then, they must define a start method that plays the role of a main method in object-oriented Java applications.

    Usage

    Local CVM are defined as subclasses of this abstract class. A CVM has to redefine deploy and may redefine start. The method start defined here defaults to starting all of the components registered as deployed on this site by calling the method addDeployedComponent. Every port that will be used to connect components must be published in the local registry by calling the method localPublishPort and it can be unpublished by calling the method localUnpublishPort.

    Invariant

     invariant              AbstractCVM.getCVM() != null

    Created on : 2011-11-18

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractCVM()
      create and initialise a local CVM.
      AbstractCVM(boolean isDistributed)
      create and initialise the CVM, tagged as distributed if the parameter is true, and as local otherwise; note however that distributed CVM must be created as subclasses of the class AbstractDistributedCVM, so this constructor should never be called directly but only through the other constructor of this class or through one of the constructors of AbstractDistributedCVM.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDeployedComponent(java.lang.String componentURI, ComponentI component)
      add a component to the set of deployed components on the CVM.
      boolean allFinalised()
      return true if the CVM has been finalised (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM).
      boolean allStarted()
      return true if the CVM has been started (i.e. all of the locally statically deployed components in the CVM).

      wait for the termination of the CVM (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.

      • awaitTermination

        public boolean awaitTermination(long timeout,
                                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: ComponentVirtualMachineI
        wait for the termination of the CVM (i.e. all of the locally deployed components in the CVM); inspired from the Java Executor framework.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        awaitTermination in interface ComponentVirtualMachineI
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait.
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument.
        Returns:
        true if this executor terminated and false if the timeout elapsed before termination.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.
        See Also:
        ComponentVirtualMachineI.awaitTermination(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit)
